clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of the Utility of Minocycline as an Anti-Inflammatory Agent in the Treatment of Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Utility of Minocycline as an Anti-Inflammatory Agent in the Treatment of Asthma

lead_sponsor.agency: State University of New York - Downstate Medical Center

clinical_study.source: State University of New York - Downstate Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: Trial of effects of minocycline as "add-on" therapy to adults with asthma with a history of requiring at least one episode of oral steroid therapy to control the disease.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a double-blind, placebo-controlled crossover study of adult asthmatics given minocycline 150 mg po BID or placebo as add-on therapy for eight weeks each. Each eight week arm is separated by a four week wash-out. Spirometry is performed at the baseline and end of each arm. Daily symptoms scores, peak flow rates, and oral steroid requirements are recorded. A standardized asthma quality of life symptoms assessment is made every four weeks (AQLQ, Juniper).

primary_outcome.measure: Decrease in oral steroid therapy requirements.

secondary_outcome.measure: improvement in morning and evening peak flow

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult asthmatics
- History of or current use of oral steroids to control symptoms
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pregnant women
